dialogues.text: HE tosses the log book on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was no flight out at eleven  o'clock. What the fuck are you trying  to pull?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first flight stateside left  Guantanamo Bay at eleven and arrived  at Andrews Airforce Base, Maryland,  at a few minutes past two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why the hell isn't it listed in  the Tower Chief's log?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why the hell did you think it would  be?!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAFFEE is silent. And now it begins to sink in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you telling me? (beat) He fixed the log book?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Setback. Big setback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Well, maybe he can make it so a plane  didn't take off, but I can sure as  hall prove that one landed. I'll get  the log book from Andrews.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARKINSON says nothing. But his face says that KAFFEE was born yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; beat) He made an entire flight disappear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan Jessep is about to be named  Director of Operations for the  National Security Council. You don't  get to that position without knowing  how to side-step a few land mines. (beat) And putting me on the stand isn't  gonna make him step on one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAFFEE stares at him. Then shakes his head, sighs, and picks the log book up of the table, and heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're taking the stand. Thursday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAFFEE leaves. HOLD on MARKINSON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAFFEE'S APARTMENT later that night and SAM and J0 have j heard the report him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's gotta be someone who can  testify to the flight. A ground crew  member. Someone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have any idea how many planes  take off and land every day? A kid  from the ground crew isn't gonna  remember a flight that landed four  weeks ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget the flight. We'll put Markinson  on the stand and we'll deal with  Jessep's refusal to transfer Santiago  and he'll testify to the forged  transfer order. That'll be enough.  That and Downey's testimony really  oughta be enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jo is working with DOWNEY. He sits on a mock witness stan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Private Downey, why did you go into  Santiago's room on the night of the  6th?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To give Private Santiago a Code Red,  ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And why did you give him a Code Red?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was ordered to give him a Code Red  by the Executive officer for Rifle  Security Company Windward, Lieutenent  Jonathan James Kendrick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JO smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna do fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOWNEY smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think they'll let us go back to  our platoon soon, ma'am?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause) Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jo is going over last-minute details with KAFFEE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember the order of the  questions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you'll use small words?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets rattled when he doesn't  understand something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jo --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just saying go slow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna go slow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And get him off as fast as you can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joanne!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gonna be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn and head into the courtroom as we HEAR MARKINSO in VOICE OVER...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dear Mr. and Mrs. Santiago..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARKINSON is writing a letter and we HEAR it in V.O.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was William's company commander.   I knew your son vaguely, which is to  say I knew his name...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And while we continue to HEAR Markinson's voice writing t letter, we begin a SERIES OF SHOTS: MARKINSON is getting  into his class A dress uniform, complete with medals, sid arm, and military dress sabre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a matter of time, the trial of  the two man charged with your son's  death will be concluded, and seven  men and two women whom you've never  met will try to offer you an  explanation as to why William is  dead. For my part, I've done as much  as I can to bring the truth to light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARKINSON is finished dressing. He stands in the middle o the motel room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) And the truth is this: your son is  dead for only one reason. I wasn't  strong enough to stop it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARKINSON takes a pistol out of his holster and cocks the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always, Captain Matthew Andrew  Markinson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARKINSON puts the pistol in his mouth --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: United states marine corps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We HEAR the BLAST of the gunshot as we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kaffee is at the end of his examination of Downey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Private, I want you to tell us one  last time: Why did you go into Private  Santiago's room on the night of August  6th?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A code red was ordered by my platoon  commander, Lt. Jonathan James  Kendrick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. (to ROSS) Your witness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Private, for the week of 2 August,  the switch log has you down at Post  39, is that correct?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure it is, sir, they keep that  log pretty good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How far is it from Post 39 to the  Windward barracks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a ways, sir, it's a hike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About how far by jeep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About ten, fifteen minutes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever had to walk it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir. That day, sir. Friday. The  Pick-up Private -- sir, that's what  we call the fella who drops us at  our posts and picks us up... also,  'cause he can get girls in New York  City -- the Pick-up Private got a  flat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the defense table, KAFFEE, poker-faced, scribbles some down on a piece of paper and slides it to JO. JO looks at it: "Where's he going with this?" JO scribbles "?" And hands back to KAFFEE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) ...Right at 39. He pulled up and  blam! ...A blowout-with no spare.  The two of us had to double-time it  back to the barracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if it's ten or fifteen minutes  by jeep, I'm guessing it must be a  good hour by foot, am I right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pick-up and me did it in 45 flat,  sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not bad. Now you say your assault on  Private Santiago was the result of  an order that Lt. Kendrick gave in  your barracks room at 16:20.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAFFEE knows what's coming. There's nothing he can do abo it. And he can't lose his cool in front of the jury.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JO. Helpless. Panicked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you just said that you didn't  make it back to Windward Barracks  until 16:45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOWNEY's confused. These are questions he hasn't been ask before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you didn't make it back to your  barracks until 16:45, then how could  you be in your room at 16:20?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause) You see sir, there was a flat tire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Private, did you ever actually hear  Lt. Kendrick order a Code Red?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAFFEE's world is falling down around him, and there's no he can do about it. And he knows it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause) No, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jo leaps to her feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please the court, I'd like to request  a recess in order to confer with my  client.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you go into Santiago's room?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The witness has rights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The witness has been read his rights,  commander.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) Hal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The question will be repeated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you go into Santiago's room?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your honor --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did Corporal Dawson tell you to do  it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is frozen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) He did, didn't he? Dawson told you  to give Santiago a code red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOWNEY looks at DAWSON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't look at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Private. Answer the Lieutenant's  question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is still silent. DOWNEY does something we've nev seen him do before. He straightens himself up and says th with the pride of a man who believes he's done the right  thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Lieutenant. I was given an order  by my squad leader, Lance Corporal  Harold W. Dawson of the U.S. Marine  Corps. And I followed it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROSS let's it hang. He looks over at KAFFEE. KAFFEE won't meet his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JO and SAM are sitting in silence. It's dark outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you think he is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAM doesn't know. JO is beside herself, and trying to kee it together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) As far as Downey was concerned, it  was an order from Kendrick. It didn't  matter that he didn't hear it first  hand. He doesn't distinguish between  the two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAM understands, but he doesn't say anything. The door op and KAFFEE walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Danny. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAFFEE seems to be in an incredibly normal mood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and I were just talking about  how all we really have to do is call  some witnesses who'll talk about  implied orders... or maybe we put  Downey back on the stand before we  get to Dawson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe if we work at it we can get  Dawson charged with the Kennedy  assassination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JO studies KAFFEE for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you drunk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a simple answer) Pretty much. Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause) I'll make a pot of coffee. We have a  long night's work ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's gonna make coffee. That's nice. (beat) He wasn't in his room. (Kaffee's amazed) He wasn't even there. (beat) That was an important piece of  information, don't you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause) Danny, it was just a setback. I'm  sorry. But we'll fix it and then  move on to Markinson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Markinson's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JO and SAM are frozen. KAFFEE says this with no particular feeling one way or th other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You really gotta hand it to those  Federal Marshals, boy. (he almost has to  laugh) It's not like he hanged himself by  his shoelaces or slashed his wrists  with a concealed butter knife. This  guy got, into full dress uniform,  stood in the middle of that room,  drew a nickle plated pistol from his  holster, and fired a bullet into his  mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jo and SAM don't say anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Anyway, since we seem to be out of  witnesses, I thought I'd drink a  little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still think we can win.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then maybe you should drink a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, we'll go to Randolph in the  morning and make a motion for a  continuance. 24 hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) Why would we want to do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To subpoena Colonel Jessep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen for a second --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just hear me out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I won't listen to you and I won't  hear you out. Your passion is  comforting, Jo. It's also useless.  Private Downey needed a trial lawyer  today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause) You chicken-shit. You're gonna use  what happened today as an excuse to  give up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's over!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you ask Jessep for the  transfer order?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Cuba. Why did you ask Jessep for  the transfer order?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does it matter --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted the damn transfer order!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit! You could've gotten it by  picking up the phone and calling any  one of a dozen departments at the  Pentagon. You didn't want the transfer  order. You wanted to see Jessep's  reaction when you asked for the  transfer order. You had an instinct.  And it was confirmed by Markinson.  Now damnit, let's put Jessep on the  stand and end this thing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What possible good could come from  putting Jessep on the stand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He told Kendrick to order the Code  Red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He did?! Why didn't you say so!?  That's qreat! And of course you have  proof of that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, I keep forgetting: You were sick  the day they taught law at law school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You put him on the stand and you get  it from him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. No problem. We get it from him. (to SAM) Colonel, isn't it true that you  ordered the Code Red on Santiago?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, we're all a little --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, your time's run out. What  do we have for the losers, Judge?  Well, for our defendants it's a  lifetime at exotic Fort Levenworth.  And for defense counsel Kaffee? That's  right -- it's -- a court -- martial.  Yes, Johnny, after falsely accusing  a marine officer of conspiracy, Lt.   Kaffee will have a long and prosperous  career teaching typewriter maintenance  at the Rocco Columbo School for Women.   Thank you for playing "Should We or  Should-We-Not Follow the Advice of  the Galacticly Stupid".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with one motion, he knocks everything from his desk. ton of papers, books, files, etc., falls to the floor. There's dead silence. Maybe just the sound of KAFFEE brea after this exhausting outburst. Finally...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I lost you your set of  steak knives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jo picks up her purse and coat and walks out. The door sl behind her. KAFFEE walks into the kitchen without a word. SAM gets down on the floor and begins picking up all the  stuff that Kaffee knocked off the desk. KAFFEE comes back in with a bottle of Jack Daniels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop cleaning up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Sam continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Sam. Stop cleaning up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAM stops and sits in a chair. KAFFEE sits on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You want a drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAM takes a swig from the bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is your father proud of you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do this to yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll bet he is. I'll bet he bores  the shit outta the neighbors and the  relatives. "Sam, made Law Review.   He's got a big case he's making --  He's arguing making an argument." (pause) I think my father would've enjoyed  seeing me graduate from law school. (beat) I think he would've liked that... an  awful lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I ever tell you that I wrote a  paper on your father in college?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was one of the best trial lawyers  ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes he was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if I were Dawson and Downey and  I had a choice between you or your  father to represent me in this case,  I'd take you any day of the week and  twice on Sunday. You should have  seen yourself thunder away at  Kendrick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you put Jessep on the stand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think my father would've?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the evidence we've got? Not in  a million years. But here's the thing -- and there's really no way of getting  around this -- neither Lionel Kaffee  nor Sam Weinberg are lead counsel  for the defense in the matter of  U.S. versus Dawson and Downey. So  there's only one question. What would  you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We HOLD on the two of them for a moment, then

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JO is walking through the night at a brisk pace. She's do her best not to fall apart. TWO HEADLIGHTS appear coming down the street, and KAFFEE' CAR, with SAM driving and KAFFEE riding shotgun, slows do alongside JO. KAFFEE rolls down his window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joanne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JO ignores them and keeps walking. The car crawls along w her. JO starts walking faster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Jo, we look ridiculous. (to SAM) Stop the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAFFEE hops out and calls --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Joanne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JO keeps walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I apologize. I was angry and... I'm  sorry about what I said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But JO'S still walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; calling) I'm gonna put Jessep on the stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops. She turns around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A nerf ball bounces off the wall. KAFFEE, JO and SAM are sprawled out in the living room. F hours now they've been trying to come up with an idea.   KAFFEE's mind seems to be on his basketball game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say we hit him with the phoney  transfer order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the transfer order without a  witness?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a witness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dead witness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And in the hands of a lesser attorney,  that'd be a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this. Last night he was  swimming in his Jack Daniels, now he  can leap tall buildings in a single  bound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm getting my second wind. Siddown.  Both of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees that SAM and JO were already sitting down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Good. (beat) Jessep told Kendrick to order a code  red. Kendrick did, and our clients  followed the order. The cover-up  isn't our case. To win, Jessep has  to tell the jury that he ordered the  code red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you think you can got him to  just say it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he wants to say it. I think  he's pissed off that he's gotta hide  from us. I think he wants to say  that he made a command decision and  that's the end of it. He eats  breakfast 80 yards away from 4000  Cubans who are trained to kill him,  and no one's gonna tell him how to  run his base. Least of all the pushy  broad, the smart Jew, and the Harvard  clown. I need to shake him and put  him on the defensive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAM and JO are silent for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it? That's the plan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna trip Jessep and he's  gonna confess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not gonna trip him. I'm gonna  lead him right where he's dying to  go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how are you gonna do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no idea. I need my bat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking around) I need my bat. I think better with  my bat. Where's my bat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I put it in the closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You put it in the closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAFFEE heads to the closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was tripping over it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't ever put a bat in a closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He thinks better with his bat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we go to KAFFEE AT THE CLOSET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can understand that. I used to  have stuffed panda named Mr. Boob. I  could never do my home work without  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: During this, KAFFEE's opened the closet door. He reaches to grab his bat when all of a sudden he notices something His clothes. His uniforms and his civilian clothes. Hanging neatly alo the bar. He stares at this a moment, then suddenly heads  back through the living room towards the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay here, I'm going to the office  for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAFFEE storms out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, he does think better with that  bat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small room at the end of a corridor at the office. KAFF stands over a printer and watches it spit out something h been waiting for. He tears the printout off and we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAFFEE is looking over the computer printout. From what w can tell, it resembles a large, military coded phone bill KAFFEE picks up the phone and dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Sam. (beat) I need you to do something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAM hangs up the phone slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's goin' on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've gotta go out to Andrews.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The day's session is going to begin in a few minutes. KAF comes around the corner and runs into Jo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Sam here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's on his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he got the guys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Listen, can I talk to you for a  second?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JO closes the door behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How're you feeling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he's gonna have his hands  full today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen. (beat) Danny. (beat) When you're out there. If it's not  gonna happen he's not gonna say it (beat) ...don't go for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAFFEE looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) If you feel like... if you feel  like... You could get in trouble. (beat) I'm special counsel for internal  affairs, and I'm telling you, you  could get in a lot of trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why Lt. Commander Galloway... are  you suggesting I back off a material  witness?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you think you can't get him. (beat) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think I can get him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) I think it doesn't matter what I  think. I'm an administrator. (beat) I can't seem to defend people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAFFEE takes that in. He picks up his briefcase and grabs his jacket. Then he turns to JO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're my hero, Joanne. (beat) From the first day, you were a lawyer. (beat) Live with that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And in VOICE OVER we HEAR the SERGEANT AT ARMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All rise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone stands at attention as RANDOLPH enters. SAM is  missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to KAFFEE) Call your witness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Sam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant, call your witness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Defense calls Colonel Nathan Jessep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JESSEP is escorted in through a side door. He's wearing h dress uniforms, adorned with the appropriate medals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel, do you solemnly swear that  the testimony you will give in this  General Court-Martial will be the  truth, the whole truth, and nothing  but the truth so help you God?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you state your name, rank, and  current billet for the record please,  air?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel Nathan R. Jessep, Commanding  officer, Marine Ground Forces,  Guantanamo Bay, Cuba.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir, would you have a  seat, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JESSEP sits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel, when you learned of  Santiago's letter to the NIS, you  had a meeting with your two senior  officers, is that right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Executive Officer, Lt. Jonathan  Kendrick, and the Company Commander,  Captain Matthew Markinson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And at present, Captain Markinson is  dead, is that right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Objection. I'd like to know just  what defense counsel is implying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm implying simply that, at present,  Captain Markinson is not alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surely Colonel Jessep doesn't need  to appear in this courtroom to confirm  that information.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wasn't sure if the witness  was aware that two days ago, Captain  Markinson took his own life with a  .45 caliber pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And from the back of the room, SAM enters. He's escorting two young AIRMEN in Airforce dress uniforms. SAM shows th AIRMEN to a seat near the front, and takes his place at t defense table. Over this we HEAR --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The witness is aware, the Court is  aware, and now the jury is aware. We  thank you for bringing this to our  attention. Move on Lieutenant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAM scribbles something on a piece of paper, KAFFEE walks over, looks at the paper on which are wrttten two names:  Cecil O'Malley and Anthony Perez, then turns back to RAND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir. Colonel, at the time of  this meeting, you gave Lt. Kendrick  an order, is that right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told Kendrick to tell his men that  Santiago wasn't to be touched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And did you give an order to Captain  Markinson as well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ordered Markinson to have Santiago  transferred off the base immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I felt that his life might be in  danger once word of the letter got  out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grave danger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there another kind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAFFEE holds up a document from his table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have the transfer order that you  and Markinson co-signed, ordering  that Santiago be lifted on a flight  leaving Guantanamo at six the next  morning. Was that the first flight  off the bass?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The six a.m. flight was the first  flight off the base.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAFFEE nods and decides to move on. JESSEP steals a quick glance at the two AIRMEN sitting ou in the courtroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel, you flew up to Washington  early this morning, is that right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I notice you're wearing your Class A  appearance in dress uniform for court  today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) As are you, Lieutenant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you wear that uniform on the  plane?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please the Court, is this dialogue  relevant to anything in particular?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The defense didn't have an opportunity  to depose this witness, your honor.   I'd ask the Court for a little  latitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A very little latitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wore fatigues on the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you brought your dress uniform  with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And a toothbrush? A shaving kit?  Change of underwear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your honor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to ROSS) Is the Colonel's underwear a matter  of national security?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen. (to KAFFEE) You better get somewhere fast with  this, Lieutenant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir. Colonel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I brought a change of clothes and  some personal items.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAFFEE gets a document from his table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) After Dawson and Downey's arrest on  the night of the sixth, Santiago's  barracks room was sealed off and its  contents inventoried. (reading) Pairs of camouflage pants, 6  camouflage shirts, 2 pairs of boots,  1 pair of brown shoes, 1 pair of  tennis shoes, 8 khaki tee-shirts, 2  belts, 1 sweater --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please the Court, is there a question  anywhere in our future?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lt. Kaffee, I have to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm wondering why Santiago wasn't  packed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That landed. On the JURY, RANDOLPH, ROSS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I'll tell you what, we'll get back  to that one in a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JO hands KAFFEE the computer printout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) This is a record of all telephone  calls made from your base in the  past 24 hours. After being subpoenaed  to Washington, you made three calls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Handing Jessep the printout --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I've highlighted those calls in  yellow. Do you recognize those  numbers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I called Colonel Fitzhuqhes in  Quantico, Va. I wanted to let him  know I'd be in town. The second call  was to set up a meeting with  Congressman Ramond of the House Armed  Services Committee, and the third  call was to my sister Elizabeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you make that call, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought she might like to have  dinner tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judge --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna put a stop to this now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jo's handed KAFFEE another printout and a stack of letter

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your honor, these are the telephone  records from GITMO for August 6th.   And these are 14 letters that Santiago  wrote in nine months requesting, in  fact begging, for a transfer. (to JESSEP) Upon hearing the news that he was  finally getting his transfer, Santiago  was so excited, that do you know how  many people he called? Zero. Nobody.  Not one call to his parents saying  he was coming home. Not one call to  a friend saying can you pick me up  at the airport. He was asleep in his  bed at midnight, and according to  you he was getting on a plane in six  hours, yet everything he owned was  hanging neatly in his closet and  folded neatly in his footlocker. You  were leaving for one day and you  packed a bag and made three phone  calls. Santiago was leaving for the  rest of his life, and he hadn't called  a soul and he hadn't packed a thing.  Can you explain that? The fact is  there was no transfer order. Santiago  wasn't going anywhere, isn't that  right, Colonel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Object. Your Honor, it's obvious  that Lt. Kaffee's intention this  morning is to smear a high ranking  marine officer in the desperate hope  that the mere appearance of  impropriety will win him points with  the jury. It's my recommendation,  sir, that Lt. Kaffee receive an  official reprimand from the bench,  and that the witness be excused with  the Court's deepest apologies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RANDOLPH ponders this a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause) Overruled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your honor --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The objection's noted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) Colonel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessep's smiling... ...and now he can't help but let out a short laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Is this funny, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's not. It's tragic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have an answer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely. My answer is I don't  have the first damn clue. Maybe he  was an early morning riser and he  liked to pack in the nq. And maybe  he didn't have any friends. I'm an  educated man, but I'm afraid I can't  speak intelligently about the travel  habits of William Santiago.  What I  do know is that he was set to leave  the base at 0600. Now are these really  the questions I was called here to  answer? Phone calls and footlockers?  Please tell me you've got something  more, Lieutenant. Please tell me  there's an ace up your sleeve. These  two marines are on trial for their  lives. Please tell me their lawyer  hasn't pinned their hopes to a phone  bill. (beat) Do you have any other questions for  me, counselor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The courtroom is silenced. Jessep's slammed the door. KAFFEE looks around the room, sees that the world is wait for him to do something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lt. Kaffee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAFFEE says nothing. He glances over to AIRMEN O'MALLEY a PEREZ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Lieutenant, do you have anything  further for this witness?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAFFEE doesn't respond. JESSEP gets up to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (standing) Thanks, Danny. I love Washington.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And JESSEP starts to leave, but he's stopped by --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, I didn't dismiss you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JESSEP turns around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I beg your pardon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not through with my examination.  Sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to RANDOLPH) I'd appreciate it if he addressed me  as Colonel or Sir. I believe I've  earned it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Defense counsel will address the  witness as Colonel or Sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to RANDOLPH) I don't know what the hell kind of  an outfit you're running here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the witness will address this  Court as Judge or Your Honor. I'm  quite certain I've earned it. Take  your seat, Colonel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessep goes back to the stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) What would you like to discuss now!  My favorite color?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel, the six a.m. flight, was  the first one off the base?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There wasn't a flight that left seven  hours earlier and landed at Andrews  Airforce Base at 2 a.m.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant, I think we've covered  this, haven't we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAFFEE gets the two log books from his table as well as t piece of paper that SAM scribbled on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Honor, these are the Tower  Chief's Logs for both Guantanamo Bay  and Andrews Airforce Base. The  Guantanamo log lists no flight that  left at eleven p.m., and the Andrews  log lists no flight that landed at 2  a.m. I'd like to admit them as Defense  Exhibits "A" and "B".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand. You're admitting  evidence of a flight that never  existed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We believe it did, sir. (glancing at the paper,  then motioning to  the AIRMEN) Defense'll be calling Airman Cecil  O'Malley and Airman Anthony Perez.  They were working the ground crew at  Andrews at two a.m. on the seventh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Honor, these men weren't on the  list. Rebuttal witnesses, Your Honor,  called specifically to refute  testimony offered under direct  examination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you looked closely at JESSEP, you could see a drop of  sweat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll allow the witnesses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel, a moment ago --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check the Tower Logs for christ's  sake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll get to the airmen in just a  minute, sir. A moment ago said that  you ordered Kendrick to order his  men not to touch Santiago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Kendrick was clear on what you  wanted?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crystal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any chance Kendrick ignored the order?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ignored the order?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any chance he just forgot about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any chance Kendrick left your office  and said, "The 'old man's wrong"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Kendrick spoke to the platoon  and ordered them not to touch  Santiago, any chance they ignored  him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever spent time in an  infantry unit, son?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever served in a forward area?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever put your life in another man's  hands, ask him to put his life in  yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We follow orders, son. We follow  orders or people die. It's that  simple. Are we clear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we clear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crystal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAFFEE speaks with the quiet confidence that comes from  knowing you're about to drop your opponents

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; beat) Colonel, I have just one more question  before I call Airman O'Malley and  Airman Perez: If you gave an order  that Santiago wasn't to be touched,  and your orders are always followed,  then why would he be in danger, why  would it be necessary to transfer  him off the base?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And JESSEP has no answer. Nothing. He sits there, and for the first time, seems to be lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Private Santiago was a sub-standard  marine. He was being transferred off  the base because --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that's not what you said. You  said he was being transferred because  he was in grave danger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause) Yes. That's correct, but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said, "He was in danger". I said,  "Grave danger". You said --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I recall what --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can have the Court Reporter read  back your --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what I said. I don't need it  read back to me like I'm a damn --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why the two orders? (beat) Colonel? (beat) Why did you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes men take matters into their  own hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sir. You made it clear just a  moment ago that your men never take  matters into their own hands. Your  men follow orders or people die. So  Santiago shouldn't have been in any  danger at all, should he have,  Colonel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone's sweating now. Everyone but KAFFEE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You little bastard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Honor, I have to ask for a recess  to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like an answer to the question,  Judge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Court'll wait for answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If Kendrick told his men that Santiago  wasn't to be touched, then why did  he have to be transferred?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessep is looking at O'MALLEY and PEREZ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Colonel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JESSEP says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Kendrick ordered the code red, didn't  he? Because that's what you told  Kendrick to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Object!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Counsel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAFFEE will plow through the objections of ROSS and the  admonishments of RANDOLPH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when it went bad, you cut these  guys loose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Honor --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'll be all, counsel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had Markinson sign a phony  transfer order --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judge --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You doctored the log books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damnit Kaffee!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll ask for the forth time. You  ordered --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want answers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'm entitled to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want answers?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't handle the truth!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And nobody moves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Son, we live in a world that has  walls. And those walls have to be  guarded by men with guns. Who's gonna  do it? You? You, Lt. Weinberg? I  have a greater responsibility than  you can possibly fathom. You weep  for Santiago and you curse the  marines. You have that luxury. You  have the luxury of not knowing what  I know: That Santiago's death, while  tragic, probably saved lives. And my  existence, while grotesque and  incomprehensible to you, saves lives. (beat) You don't want the truth. Because  deep down, in places you don't talk  about at parties, you want me on  that wall. You need me there. (boasting) We use words like honor, code,  loyalty... we use these words as the  backbone to a life spent defending  something. You use 'em as a punchline. (beat) I have neither the time nor the  inclination to explain myself to a  man who rises and sleeps under the  blanket of the very freedom I provide,  then questions the manner in which I  provide it. I'd prefer you just said  thank you and went on your way.  Otherwise, I suggest you pick up a  weapon and stand a post. Either way,  I don't give a damn what you think  you're entitled to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Did you order the code red?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) I did the job you sent me to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you order the code red?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause) You're goddamn right I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. From everyone. RANDOLPH, ROSS, the M.P.'s, they' all frozen. JO and SAM are likewise. JESSEP seems strange quietly relieved. KAFFEE simply takes control of the room now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please the court, I suggest the jury  be dismissed so that we can move to  an immediate Article 39a Session.   The witness has rights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. RANDOLPH looks to ROSS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lt. Ross?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROSS is frozen. He doesn't know what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as a friend) Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROSS looks at KAFFEE, then JESSEP, then nods his head "ye to RANDOLPH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sergeant at Arms will take the  jury to an ante-room where you'll  wait until further instruction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SERGEANT AT ARMS begins leading the JURORS out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one will say anything until the jurors are out of the  room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; to captain) Captain, what the hell's going on? I  did my job. I'd do it again. Now I'm  getting on a plane and going back to  my base.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M.P.'s, guard the prisoner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The M.P.'s are tentative. They've never heard a marine co referred to as "the prisoner" before. They sure as hell h never been asked to guard one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guard the prisoner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel Jessep, you have the right  to remain silent. Any statement you  do make can be used against you in a  trial by court-martial or other  judicial or administrative proceeding.   You have the right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROSS continues reading JESSEP his rights, over --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm being charged with a crime? I'm --  that's what this is -- (to Ross) Marine! (Ross keeps going) Marine!! (Ross is doing his  job.) I'm being charged with a crime? I'm --  that's what's happening? This -- I'm -- this is funny, you know that, this  is --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And JESSEP lunges at KAFFEE, and KAFFEE would be dead but for the three M.P.'s who've leapt in to restrain JESSEP. SAM and JO have come to their feet and stand behind KAFFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; to Kaffee) I'm gonna tear your eyes right outta  your head and piss in your dead skull.   You fucked with the wrong marine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROSS is done reading JESSEP his rights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel Jessep, do you understand  those rights as I have just read  then to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saved lives. That boy was -- there  was a weak link. I saved lives, you  hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The courtroom is silent from Jessep's outburst. Jessep sh his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You fuckin' people. (beat) You have no idea how to defend a  nation. (continuing; to KAFFEE) All you did was weaken a country  today, Kaffee. That's all you did.  You put people in danger. Sweet  dreams, son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't call me son. (beat) I'm a lawyer, and an officer of the  United States Navy. And you're under  arrest you sonofabitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAFFEE stays on JESSEP a moment longer, then remembers --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) The witness is excused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The M.P.'s start leading JESSEP out, and KAFFEE notices  DAWSON. And DOWNEY. And ROSS. who are watching a man in a marine colonels uniform be led away in handcuffs... KAFFE takes a handkerchief from his pocket and wipes some sweat from his hands. He takes a deep breath as we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's low murmur in the room as the JURORS are being le back into their box. Everyone's in place. RANDOLPH enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten-hut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All rise. And sit when RANDOLPH sits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have the jurors reached a verdict?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SERGEANT AT ARMS takes all the slips of paper from th FOREMAN and brings them to RANDOLPH. KAFFEE stands, and nods to DAWSON and DOWNEY that they sh do the same. SAM and JO stand as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading) On the charge of Murder, the Members  find the defendants Not Guilty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's hard to resist the temptation to scream and shout, b they do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; reading) On the charge of Conspiracy to Commit  Murder, the Members find the  defendants Not Guilty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RANDOLPH looks up. Then reads from the last slip of paper

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) On the charge of Conduct Unbecoming  a United States Marine, the members  find the defendants Guilty as Charged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little of the energy drains out of the room. RANDOLPH  continues reading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; reading) The defendants are hereby sentenced  by this court to time already served,  and are ordered...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RANDOLPH clears his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) ...And are ordered to be dishonorably  discharged from the marine corps. (pause) This Court-Martial is adjourned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RANDOLPH raps his gavel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten hut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All rise. RANDOLPH's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Dismissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The M.P.'s move to DAWSON and DOWNEY to unlock their  handcuffs. KAFFEE is packing up his things, just another at the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold, I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand. Colonel Jessep  said he ordered the Code Red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel Jessep said he ordered the  Code Red, what did we do wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not as simple as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did we do wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We did nothing wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAM slaps his hands down on the table --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you did! A jury just said your  conduct was unbecoming a marine.  What does that mean?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the marine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAM lets it hang. DAWSON is staring at SAM. His stare mov slowly to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I never meant to hurt Willy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAWSON looks up at HIS PARENTS. The moment hangs there... before

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kaffee, I've gotta take these guys  over to personnel for some paper  work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAFFEE nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; to Dawson  & Downey) Gentleman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAWSON looks to KAFFEE. There's gotta be more. This can't it. But KAFFEE has nothing to say. DAWSON and DOWNEY walk to the SERGEANT AT ARMS and begin follow him up the aisle and out of the courtroom. But bef they get to the door, KAFFEE turns around and calls

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stop and turn around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause) You don't need to wear a patch on  your arm to have honor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAWSON stares at KAFFEE for a long moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten-hut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAWSON and DOWNEY come to attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) There's an officer on deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAWSON snaps a salute and holds it. KAFFEE stares back. Then stands up straight and returns t salute. With one last glance back at KAFFEE, DAWSON turns and wal out the door, followed by DOWNEY. ROSS walks over to the defense table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Airmen Cecil O'Malley and Anthony  Perez? What exactly were these guys  gonna testify to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless I'm mistaken they were gonna  testify, under oath, that they have  absolutely no recollection of  anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROSS smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strong witnesses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And very handsome, too, don't you  think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see you around the campus.   I've gotta go arrest Kendrick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him I say "Hi".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAFFEE, JO and SAM are walking down the steps. The BAND i practicing on the parade grounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you say we take the rest of  the day off. Go out someplace. Sam?  Champagne? Yoo-Hoo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, I can't. I'm gonna go home  and talk to my daughter. I think  she's gotta be bilingual by now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And SAM heads off toward his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's next for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Staff Sargeant Henry Williamson. He  went to the movies on company time.  What about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me? Oh... you know... the usual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just pretty much generally annoying  people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. (pause) So what do you say? How 'bout a  celebration?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. How 'bout a date. A real date.  Dinner. Attractive clothes. The works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds good.  Who do you think I  should call?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll pick you up at seven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you gonna do now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna get started on Henry  Williamson. (beat) Stand my post for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JO holds out her hand. KAFFEE shakes it. JO kisses him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wear matching socks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jo splits off toward her building and KAFFEE keeps walkin toward the bleachers as we PULL BACK TO INCLUDE the almos empty parade grounds and PULL BACK as to show the Washing Navy Yard and PULL BACK and back and back and
